newsitem.title: GERMANY: Lufthansa cancelled 18 flights due to 2-hr strike.
newsitem.headline: Lufthansa cancelled 18 flights due to 2-hr strike.

text.p: German airline Deutsche Lufthansa said on Monday 18 flights had been cancelled and 11 delayed as a result of a two-hour strike by flight crews and ground staff in Germany.

German white-collar trade union DAG, or Deutsche Angesellten-Gewerkschaft, called a strike by Lufthansa employees at Frankfurt, Munich and Hamburg airports between 0600 GMT and 0800 GMT to back a four percent wage claim.
Lufthansa said most of the flights affected were on domestic routes although some international flights within Europe were also hit. The airline operates 1,500 flights a day worldwide.
Lufthansa issued a statement calling on the DAG to return to the negotiating table immediately.
The union had warned on Friday it planned "limited industrial action" after Lufthansa refused to meet its demand for a four percent wage increase for 1997 in talks that collapsed last month.
"With this industrial action we want to make Lufthansa's management put a better offer on the table in wage talks," DAG chief negotiator Michael Tarp said in a statement.
A DAG spokesman said no further strikes had been scheduled yet.
